title: Ikea Japan to Install 1MW Solar Plant at New Shop
text:
Ikea Japan to Install 1MW Solar Plant at New Shop Ikea Japan to Install 1MW Solar Plant at New Shop 2015/09/04 17:27 Kenji Kaneko, Nikkei BP CleanTech Institute 
Ikea Japan, a Japanese subsidiary of Sweden-based Ikea, announced Aug 26, 2015, that it will install a solar power generation system with an output of about 1MW in a new shop to be built in Nagakute City, Aichi Prefecture, Japan. 
At the new shop, Ikea Japan will also install a geothermal power generation system to reduce energy consumption to 70% of that of its existing shops in Japan. 
Currently, Ikea Japan runs eight shops in Japan. In fiscal 2016, it plans to build new shops in Kumamoto and Nagakute cities.
